issue.title: Fix RAILS_VERSION parameter in the test pipeline
issue.body: The way it's currently set causes it to install 7.1 instead of 7.0, which is not the expected behavior. I've updated the version provided in the test pipeline to lock correctly to 7.0.x

comment.body: Changes preview: Legend: 👀 Review pull request on Viezly

commits.message: Fix RAILS_VERSION parameter in the test pipeline

Merge pull request #11941 from spree/chore/fix_rails_version_in_test_pipeline

Fix RAILS_VERSION parameter in the test pipeline

pull_request.title: Fix RAILS_VERSION parameter in the test pipeline
pull_request.body: The way it's currently set causes it to install 7.1 instead of 7.0, which is not the expected behavior. I've updated the version provided in the test pipeline to lock correctly to 7.0.x

review.body: Please pass the coder as a keyword argument also

pull_request.title: fix/Use keyword argument when passing a class to `serialize`
pull_request.body:
### **What?**
Adhere to newer way of invocating `serialize`.

### **Why?**
In Rails 7.2 it'll be deprecated.
[source](https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/v7.1.0.beta1/activerecord/lib/active_record/attribute_methods/serialization.rb#L183C14-L183C14)

### **How?**
Pass serialization class as a keyword argument.

It also has been suggested how to do it in the error message:

```
Please pass the class as a keyword argument:

  serialize :preferences, type: Hash
  ```
